oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Random recollections of a near-nonagenarian, by Clarence B. Wallace, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1949
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A typescript, for publication in the Chi Phi Chakett, by Clarence B. Wallace, reminiscing about his homestate of Virginia, education at the Hampden-Sydney School from 1877-1880, and the college’s chapter of Chi Phi Fraternity. He discusses attending the University of Virginia and participation in the Chi Phi Fraternity. Professor Wallace, a graduate of Hampden-Sydney and the University of Virginia, was a founder and headmaster of Wallace University School, a preparatory school for Vanderbilt University. He was was the school’s sole headmaster for its 55-year existence from circa 1886 - 1941. Forms part of the Clarence Wallace Bainbridge Collection. 1 typescript.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wallace, Clarence B., 1859-1950
